quick-start.title: Quick Start
quick-start.description: Discover how to get started with Remix PWA in a Remix project

v4.title: Ugrading to v4
v4.description: This documentation covers the process of upgrading to v4 from older versions of Remix PWA.

community.title: Community
community.description: At the core of Remix PWA lies a passionate community of developers dedicated to open-source collaboration, knowledge-sharing, and driving the evolution of PWA technologies.

default-fetch-handler.title: defaultFetchHandler
default-fetch-handler.description: Your default handler for fetching requests in your Service Worker.

error-handler.title: errorHandler
error-handler.description: Your last defence against unhandled errors in your worker routes. Gracefully handle errors without breaking your Remix app.

get-load-context.title: getLoadContext
get-load-context.description: Global context object for the worker thread. Share data globally between your workers in your routes and the entry service worker.

worker-action.title: workerAction
worker-action.description: Route Worker API for intercepting and handling non-GET request within a route.

worker-loader.title: workerLoader
worker-loader.description: Worker route API for handling GET requests in the worker thread. Bring the power of Service Workers directly to your Remix routes.

manifest-link.title: ManifestLink
manifest-link.description: A quick component to link to a manifest file.

use-sw-effect.title: useSWEffect
use-sw-effect.description: React hook to facilitate worker messaging and notify Service Worker about location-based changes

use-badge-api.title: useBadgeApi
use-badge-api.description: A utility hook to interact with the Web Badging API, allowing you to set notification badges on your app.

use-battery-manager.title: useBatteryManager
use-battery-manager.description: The useBatteryManager hook to interact with the BatteryManager API.

use-network-connectivity.title: useNetworkConnectivity
use-network-connectivity.description: A utility hook for interacting with device network connectivity state.

use-permission.title: usePermission
use-permission.description: A hook on the Permission API; allowing you to check various permissions on the client.

use-push.title: usePush
use-push.description: A one-in-all utility hook for handling everything push notifications in your PWA application!

use-pwa-manager.title: usePWAManager
use-pwa-manager.description: A utility hook to manage your PWA application as a whole.

cache-api.title: Cache API
cache-api.description: This page takes you on a tour of caching in the browser with Remix PWA and the utilities provided

defer.title: defer
defer.description: A utility to defer promises and stream responses to the client

json.title: json
json.description: A utility to create JSON responses from objects

logger.title: Logger
logger.description: Logger is a logging utility build for better looking logs in the console.

misc.title: Miscellaneous
misc.description: A list of Service Worker utilities not worthy to have pages of their own.

pwa-utils.title: PWA Utilities
pwa-utils.description: A list of the numerous utilities Remix PWA ships with to help you build and fine-tune your PWA experience

redirect.title: redirect
redirect.description: A utility to send a redirect response to the client.

browser-support.title: Browser Support
browser-support.description: Not all browsers are created equal. A few things to keep in mind when developing for the web.

cli.title: Remix PWA CLI
cli.description: Streamlining PWA Development with a Powerful Command-Line Interface

contributing.title: Contributing to Remix PWA
contributing.description: Contributions are welcome. But with all things in life, there are things to take note about. This guide details how to contribute to Remix PWA.

deployment.title: Deployment
deployment.description: A guide on how to safely and successfully deploy your PWAs

enhanced-cache.title: EnhancedCache
enhanced-cache.description: Meet EnhancedCache, a cache wrapper that provides utilities to manage, visualize, and monitor caches.

env.title: Environment Variables
env.description: Environment variables are a way to store app state and config data outside of your codebase. A guide to access them safely within Remix PWA

gotchas.title: Gotchas
gotchas.description: A list of waht-not-to-do's and gotchas in Remix PWA. Safety first üòú!

messaging.title: Service Worker Messaging
messaging.description: Build a comprehensive communication system between your service worker and client.

offline.title: Offline Guide
offline.description: Add offline capabilities to your applications with Remix PWA

push-api.title: Push API
push-api.description: Push API enables web applications to receive push messages from servers for re-engaging users, delivering timely updates, and fostering a persistent connection with the app.

runtimes.title: Worker Runtimes
runtimes.description: Runtimes are the foundations of Remix PWA service workers. Come explore how they work and the magic behind 'em üßô‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

versioning.title: Versioning
versioning.description: Ensuring Seamless Updates and Efficient Caching with Versioned Service Workers

web-manifest.title: Web Manifest
web-manifest.description: Web Manifests are the heart of PWAs. Explore how to create a Web Manifest for your Remix PWA in this guide.
